definition: the activity of working to achieve political or social change, especially as a member of an organization with particular aims
a loud unpleasant sound made by a donkey
a loud unpleasant way of talking or laughing
action taken to prevent the activities of political groups who use violence to try to achieve their aims
a person with political views that are not extreme
an economic system in which a country’s businesses and industry are controlled and run for profit by private owners rather than by the government
the political system in which all farms, businesses and industries are owned by the state or by all the people
the political relations between countries and groups of countries in the world, as influenced by their geography; the study of these relations
the belief that countries should work together in a friendly way
the policy or practice of a government influencing the economy of its own country, or of becoming involved in the affairs of other countries
the policy of not becoming involved in the affairs of other countries or groups
the belief that a country should have great military strength in order to be powerful
the use of economic or political pressure by powerful countries to control or influence other countries
a type of liberalism that favours a global free market, without government regulation, with businesses and industry controlled and run for profit by private owners
the existence of many different groups of people in one society, for example people of different political or religious beliefs, or people from different ethnic groups
the belief that it is possible and good for different groups of people to live together in peace in one society
the fact of having more than one job or position at the same time, especially in the Church
in a way that is impressive and usually costs a lot of money
in a way that involves large or generous amounts of something
in a beautiful and expensive manner
used to express the fact that something has a pleasant strong colour, taste or smell
in a generous way
in a way that people think is right and good
used to express the fact that the quality or thing mentioned is present in large amounts
that copies somebody/something
to make something, especially somebody’s confidence or authority, gradually weaker or less effective
to make something weaker at the base, for example by digging under it
to do something to reduce or prevent the bad or harmful effects of something
to try to destroy the authority of a political, religious, etc. system by attacking it secretly or indirectly
to challenge somebody’s ideas or expectations and make them consider the opposite
the state of not supporting either side in a disagreement, competition or war
soldiers who fight on foot
the head of government in Germany or Austria
the government minister who is responsible for financial affairs
the official head of a university in Britain. Chancellor is an honorary title.
the head of some American universities
used in the titles of some senior state officials in Britain
containing a lot of salt
the ability to predict what is likely to happen and to use this to prepare for the future
a sea animal that looks like a large fish with a pointed mouth. Porpoises are similar to dolphins but smaller.
connected with semiotics
soft, smooth and shiny like silk
smooth and gentle
made of silk
very smooth or soft
a type of cloth made from silk, cotton or nylon, with a thick, soft surface

if you use the words an iron fist/hand when describing the way that somebody behaves, you mean that they treat people severely. This treatment may be hidden behind a kind appearance (the velvet glove).
pleasantly smooth and soft
the activity, especially in politics, of getting into a situation that could be very dangerous in order to frighten people and make them do what you want
a type of hard wheat, used to make pasta
